Package edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.scheduler

Class WolfScheduler

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.scheduler.WolfScheduler
public class WolfScheduler extends Object
Manages the scheduling of courses for a user, including maintaining a course catalog, creating and modifying schedules, and exporting schedules to files.
Author:
Dania Swelam

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    WolfScheduler()
    Default constructor constructs a new WolfScheduler with a default title, an empty catalog, and an empty schedule
    WolfScheduler(String filename)
    Parameterized constructor constructs a new WolfScheduler with a default title, reads courses from the specified file, and adds them to the catalog.

  • Constructor Details

    • WolfScheduler

      public WolfScheduler()
      Default constructor constructs a new WolfScheduler with a default title, an empty catalog, and an empty schedule

    • WolfScheduler

      public WolfScheduler(String filename)
      Parameterized constructor constructs a new WolfScheduler with a default title, reads courses from the specified file, and adds them to the catalog.
      Parameters:
      filename - The name of the file to read course records from.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the file cannot be found or read.

  • Method Details

    • getCourseCatalog

      public String[][] getCourseCatalog()
      Returns a size 4 array representation of the course catalog. Each row of the array includes the name, section, title, and meetingString in the catalog.
      Returns:
      A 4D array representation of the course catalog.

    • getScheduledActivities

      public String[][] getScheduledActivities()
      /** Returns a 4D array representation of the scheduled activities.
      Returns:
      A 4D array representation of the scheduled sctivities.

    • getFullScheduledActivities

      public String[][] getFullScheduledActivities()
      Returns an array of length 7 containing the course name, section, title, credits, instructor ID, meeting string, and an empty string.
      Returns:
      A full 7D array representation of the scheduled activities.

    • getCourseFromCatalog

      public Course getCourseFromCatalog(String name, String section)
      Retrieves a course from the catalog based on its name and section.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the course.
      section - The section of the course.
      Returns:
      The course from the catalog, or null if not found.

    • removeActivityFromSchedule

      public boolean removeActivityFromSchedule(int idx)
      Removes a course from the schedule based on its name and section.
      Parameters:
      idx - the index of the Activity you want to remove from the schedule.
      Returns:
      True if the course was removed, false otherwise.

    • getScheduleTitle

      public String getScheduleTitle()
      Returns the title of schedule.
      Returns:
      The schedule title.

    • setScheduleTitle

      public void setScheduleTitle(String scheduleTitle)
      Sets the schedule title to the provided value.
      Parameters:
      scheduleTitle - The new schedule title.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the provided title is null.

    • addCourseToSchedule

      public boolean addCourseToSchedule(String name, String section)
      Adds a course to the schedule based on its name and section.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the course.
      section - The section of the course.
      Returns:
      True if the course was added, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the user is already enrolled in the course.

    • resetSchedule

      public void resetSchedule()
      Resets the schedule, removing all courses.

    • exportSchedule

      public void exportSchedule(String filename)
      Exports the current schedule to a file.
      Parameters:
      filename - The name of the file to export the schedule to.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the file cannot be saved.

    • addEventToSchedule

      public void addEventToSchedule(String eventTitle, String eventMeetingDays, int eventStartTime, int eventEndTime, String eventDetails)
      Adds a new event to the schedule, checking for duplicates based on the event title. If a duplicate event is found, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      eventTitle - the title of the new event.
      eventMeetingDays - the meeting days of the new event.
      eventStartTime - the start time of the new event in military format.
      eventEndTime - the end time of the new event in military format.
      eventDetails - additional details or description of the new event.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if a duplicate event already exists in the schedule.
